title: Authors and Citation
text: Brian O'Meara. Author, maintainer.

title: Authors and Citation
text: O'Meara B (2022). taxon2tree: clade name, download sequences make tree. R package version 0.0.0.9000.
code: @Manual{,   title = {taxon2tree: From a clade name, download sequences and make a tree},   author = {Brian O'Meara},   year = {2022},   note = {R package version 0.0.0.9000}, }

what: From a clade name, download sequences and make a tree
title: From a clade name, download sequences and make a tree
text: Workflow make tree taxon, leaning heavily phylotaR, plus scripts around make slightly easier (making partition files, eliminating gappy sites, throwing clusters genes without enough taxa, etc.). use , please cite papers phylotaR: Bennett, D., Hettling, H., Silvestro, D., Zizka, ., Bacon, C., Faurby, S., … Antonelli, . (2018). phylotaR: Automated Pipeline Retrieving Orthologous DNA Sequences GenBank R. Life, 8(2), 20. DOI:10.3390/life8020020 Sanderson, M. J., Boss, D., Chen, D., Cranston, K. ., & Wehe, . (2008). PhyLoTA Browser: Processing GenBank molecular phylogenetics research. Systematic Biology, 57(3), 335–346. DOI:10.1080/10635150802158688 can also cite taxon2tree package. Note errors likely come package, phylotaR. run, basic approach : make bunch folders current working directory: phylotaR_run: folder raw phylotaR results seqs_raw: original clusters (sets putative genes) seqs_processed: clusters grouped gene name, grouping seqs_raw clusters seqs_gappy_removed: clusters gappy sites removed, processing seqs_processed partition.txt: Partitions mtDNA, cpDNA, 18S, 28S, everything else put additional partition. partition_bygene.txt: putative gene partition _targets: uses targets workflow R help batch processing. later step misconfigured fails, can correct , tell workflow start point (.e., targets::tar_invalidate(raxmlrun) want redo raxml step), call BatchRun() [taxon name], workflow pick left . also seqs_direct_download folder; want download fasta file mitochondrial genomes, can put mtgenomes.fasta rerun workflow (targets::tar_invalidate('process_genes') rerun using BatchRun(). However, lot happens hood. run, must : install.packages("ape","phangorn", "phylotaR", "rentrez", "targets") also must Biostrings Bioconductor installed: also must NCBI tools (BLAST) raxml installed. Install NCBI tools . raxml, can install perhaps easier using homebrew. First install homebrew, brew install brewsci/bio/raxml. also need know paths tools. default, program assumes raxmlHPC path, wrong. go terminal window, start typing raxml hit tab, see installed versions. Pick one, terminal type raxmlXXX XXX raxml name (.e., raxmlHPC-SS3) tell path . run workflow , example BatchRun("Myrmecocystus", raxml="/usr/local/bin/raxmlHPC-SSE3") use install raxml. Similarly, folder NCBI tools assumed /usr/local/bin (location tools, applications ), can change ncbi_path argument BatchRun(). works well seqs_final output raxml runs, including RAxML_bestTree.combined, bootstrap trees .
code: library(taxon2tree) BatchRun("Myrmecocystus") if (!require("BiocManager", quietly = TRUE))     install.packages("BiocManager")  BiocManager::install("Biostrings")

title: Runs the whole analysis — BatchRun

title: Runs the whole analysis — BatchRun
text: taxon clade NCBI taxonomy mintaxa many taxa needed gene included ncbi_path Path NCBI tools installed raxml Name raxml executable; include full path $PATH starts analysis; already started computer crashed, pick left . run current working directory. clade NCBI map single NCBI id; synonym, try specifying search terms rentrez::entrez_search finds correct id.
